intro: Seseli inundatum, commonly known as water seseli, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist or wet habitats such as marshes and stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small white or greenish flowers. Seseli inundatum is often found in riparian zones and is adapted to aquatic or semi-aquatic environments.
